subject: RE: [junit] Reply soon
msgSnippet: Hi Sandhya, what servlet engine you are using and whatz version No?Tomcat 3.o or later supports the webapplications or you can use Weblogic.I am not sure with
messageBody:
Hi Sandhya,
what servlet engine you are using and whatz version No?Tomcat 3.o or later
supports the webapplications or you can use Weblogic.I am not sure with
J2ee..
If not using tomcat,try with tomcat.
Regards,
Sudhir

-----Original Message-----
From: Sandhya Sree [mailto:sandhya.sree@...]
Sent: Wednesday, May 30, 2001 6:30 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Reply soon


Thanks sudhir,

Though I have set the class path for Cactus.properties file..As my your
servlet engine does not support web applications, i have set the
CLASSPATH in my servlet engine....now it is throwing the following
exception

java.io.FileNotFoundException:
http://172.20.10.100/PayMate/ServletRedirector
at
sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(HttpURLConnection
.java:526)

at
org.apache.commons.cactus.client.ServletHttpClient.doTest(ServletHttpClient.
java:109)

at
org.apache.commons.cactus.ServletTestCase.runGenericTest(ServletTestCase.jav
a:153)

at
org.apache.commons.cactus.ServletTestCase.runTest(ServletTestCase.java:128)

at
org.apache.commons.cactus.AbstractTestCase.runBare(AbstractTestCase.java:266
)

[Note:I have followed the steps given in
commons-cactus-23-20010502\doc\installation.html]

i have set in the properties file
like.."http://172.20.10.100/PayMate/ServletRedirector"
i don't know where this ServletRedirector exists..

please reply soon
regards,
Sandhya Sree



SUDHIR Amanana wrote:

> Hi,Did you set the classpath for Cactus in your environment.And just
> check whether the Cactus.properties file is in your class path?and
> you have to include servlet mapping in your web.xml.Regards,sudhir
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Sandhya Sree [mailto:sandhya.sree@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, May 30, 2001 4:11 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Reply soon
>
>
>
> Hi,
> Iam familiar in writing testcases for bussiness
> objects using JUnit and now iam trying to write the testcase
> for the servlets for which iam making use of Cactus.I have
> set the path for commons-cactus.jar.I have used import
> statements like...
> import org.apache.commons.cactus.*;
> import org.apache.commons.cactus.util.*;
>
> Iam able to compile the java files while run time it is
> throwing the following exception
>
> java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError:
> java.util.MissingResourceException: Can't find resource for
> base name cactus, locale en_US
> at
> java.util.ResourceBundle.getBundle(ResourceBundle.java:423)
> at
> java.util.ResourceBundle.getBundle(ResourceBundle.java:339)
> at
>
org.apache.commons.cactus.client.AbstractHttpClient.<clinit>(AbstractHttpCli
ent.java:82)
>
> at
> java.lang.FloatingDecimal.<clinit>(FloatingDecimal.java:1662)
>
> at
>
org.apache.commons.cactus.AbstractTestCase.runBare(AbstractTestCase.java:266
)
>
> I will be very grateful to you if you send me the solution
> asap
>
> regards,
> Sandhya Sree
